title: Who found out that people had bacteria? - Quora

response.answer_text: Bacteria were first observed by the Dutch microscopist Antonie van Leeuwenhoek in 1676, using a single-lens microscope of his own design. [190] He then published his observations in a series of letters to the Royal Society of London. [191] [192] [193] Bacteria were Leeuwenhoek's most remarkable microscopic discovery. For more read the lengthy article at Wikipedia: Bacteria A domain of prokaryotes – single celled organisms without a nucleus
